job description:
State Street Global Advisors is looking for research scientists with experience running a data science/machine learning project from inception to completion. The candidate will be part of Technology Architecture team within a Financial Services firm and will help in assessing existing technology capabilities, gathering business technology requirements, applying data science, AI and machine learning, research/prototype for predictive and prescriptive analytics and potential solutions, and documenting the end to end process. This involves working closely with Quantitative Research teams. Technology areas/platforms may include Big Data (i.e., Hadoop, Text Analytics), Business Intelligence.

Primary Job Duties and Responsibilities

Work closely with Research teams for the development and execution of a research agenda surrounding some of the core business problems, the data you will be working with will be both Structured and Unstructured. The candidate will be performing the following duties:
  • Understand and define business problems, research analytical solutions, and determine the datato be used in providing needed business insight
  • Analyze data using a variety of advanced analytics and machine learning techniques in order to build an initial proof of concept
  • Build high-quality prototypes and implement the solution in a scalable framework like Spark
  • Train, test, and validate the analytical models to ensure that the model achieves and/or exceeds the expected accuracy levels
  • Communicate findings to product owner and a broader audience of technical and non-technical colleagues
  • Lead projects, contribute to teams, and mentor junior analysts/data scientists
  • Innovate and continue to improve the accuracy of the models using a variety of techniques
  • Query, assemble, clean, normalize, and transform datasets in preparation for analysis
  • Collaborate with other data scientists to innovate and continuously improve the accuracy of models using a variety of techniques
  • Leverage industry best practices; shares the same with team
Educational Qualifications and Preferred Prior Skills/Experience
  • MS or PhD in engineering or a related field (computer science, deep learning, mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Econometrics, Economics) from a reputed University, formally educated in data science.
  • Work from our Boston, MA office
  • Valid US work authorization; we do not sponsor visas at this time
  • Job-related experience, 8 years, OR Master's Degree and job-related experience, 6 years, OR Doctorate Degree and job-related experience, 3 years
  • Experience in data modeling, 5yrs
  • Solid understanding of applied statistics, such as probability distributions, measures of dispersion and central tendency, hypothesis testing and statistical inferences.
  • 3 yrs. experience with machine learning algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Random Forest, Linear Regression, ARIMA, Neural Nets, Deep learning, etc.
  • State of the art deep learning (e.g., hyper-parameter tuning, sequence-to-sequence methods, word/entity embedding's, CNNs, etc.)
  • Model evaluation; Feature engineering; Big data experience; Familiarity with time series analytics
  • Solid grounding in statistics, probability theory, data modeling, machine learning algorithms and software development techniques and languages used to implement analytics solutions
  • Must be able to formulate an ML problem, analyze/explore/identify relevant data, apply various methods for feature modelling, and leverage suitable ML algorithms.
  • Must be able to explain the logic and reasoning behind the ML models, and identify the best strategy, algorithm or techniques for a particular problem, and/or develops one if none already exist. Should be able to custom design new ensembles of existing algorithms
  • Must be thoroughly hands-on and should be able to put theory into practice by writing code, building visualizations and fine-tuning existing algorithms.
  • Experience with one or more data science toolkits, such as Azure ML, AWS ML, R, scikit-learn, Matlab, SAS, pyspark, yarn
  • Experience with a deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, CNTK, etc.)
